content.question: In an experiment, a student finds that <math alttext="10 kilojoules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></math> of thermal energy is needed to raise the temperature of <math alttext="5 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> of a substance from <math alttext="21 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>21</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mtext>C</mtext></math> to <math alttext="37 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>37</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mtext>C</mtext></math>. Which of the following is approximately equal to the thermal energy required to change the temperature of <math alttext="15 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>15</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> of the substance from <math alttext="40 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>40</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mtext>C</mtext></math> to <math alttext="44 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>44</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup><mtext>C</mtext></math>?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
